thread.section_title: Sports - Sault Ste. Marie Evening News - Sault Ste. Marie, MI
thread.title: EUP football roundup

author: Staff reports
title: EUP football roundup
text: Staff reports Posted Oct. 3, 2015 at 5:46 PM By Staff reports Posted Oct. 3, 2015 at 5:46 PM ST. IGNACE – The St. Ignace Saints completed another unbeaten run through the Ski Valley Conference and punched their playoff ticket with a 60-0 shutout over Mancelona Friday night. Saints quarterback Gage Kreski was 8-of-12 passing for 145 yards and three touchdowns, and he also ran for a 5-yard TD. Kenny Rickley ran for a pair of touchdowns, while Kyle Sistrunk and Steve Seccia also scored TDs for the Saints (6-0 Ski Valley and overall). The Saints compiled 326 yards rushing. Rickley was the leader with 63 yards, while Jamas Gustafston and Mitch Peterson added 50 yards each. David LaVake was the receiving leader with three catches for 93 yards and two TDs. On defense, Alex France made nine tackles. Mitch Snyder had eight tackles and recovered a fumble. Sistrunk had seven tackles and LaVake had six. St. Ignace is scheduled to play Ironwood at Gladstone this upcoming Saturday. Posen 28, Cedarville 26: The Vikings turned back the Trojans in a matchup of Bridge Alliance leaders Friday night. Cedarville controlled the football, running 93 plays and gaining over 500 yards of offense. But Posen (6-0 overall, 4-0 Bridge Alliance) won the turnover battle 3-0 and turned in some big plays of its own to take over sole possession of first place in the conference. “It was a frustrating game,” Cedarville coach Scott Barr said. “We moved the ball up and down the field. We were getting five yards or more a carry. But in the end, we didn’t capitalize on our opportunities and let a game slip away.” The game was tied at 14 at halftime. Cedarville quarterback Trey Norris threw a 20-yard touchdown pass to Jordan Bailey, and Bailey also had a 9-yard scoring run. Posen’s scores came on a 75-yard run from Skyler Tulgetske on the first play of the game. Tulgetske also turned in a game-changing play late in the half as he intercepted a pass and returned it 44 yards for a TD. Cedarville, which amassed 375 yards rushing in the game, drove deep into Posen territory on the first drive of the second half before being stopped on downs. Posen took the lead again on a 95-yard touchdown run from Evan Schuch. The teams traded scores, as Cedarville had a 10-yard TD run from Bailey. Posen added a 33-yard TD run from Schuch. Cedarville had a chance to tie after a 1-run TD run from Kurt Matkovich with 7:20 left. But the 2-point conversion was stopped, leaving Posen with a 28-26 lead. After forcing Posen to punt on the next series, the Trojans had a final chance but fumbled. Matkovich led the Trojans with 204 yards rushing, while Bailey added 96 yards and Mike Haske had 65 rushing yards. Page 2 of 2 - Norris was 9-of-14 passing for 155 yards, with one touchdown and two interceptions. Matkovich made three catches for 60 yards, while Chase Massey added 30 yards on three catches. Defensivley, Massey made five tackles, while Bailey, Colton Bucht and Derek Burger added four stops each. Bailey also had two quarterback sacks and Berger had one for the Trojans (4-2 overall, 3-1 Bridge Alliance). Cedarville visits Bellaire this upcoming Friday. Bellaire 37, Pickford 26: The Panthers couldn’t overcome an early deficit and dropped a Bridge Alliance road game Friday night. Four interceptions, including two which were returned 90 or more yards for touchdowns, were back-breakers for the Panthers. Hayden Niepoth ran for 209 yards on 29 carries and two touchdowns, and also returned an interception 97 yards for a TD for the Eagles (4-2 overall, 3-1 Bridge Alliance). After falling behind 16-0 in the opening the quarter, the Panthers got within two points by halftime. Quarterback Ian Firack scored on a 2-yard run and Wyatt Boik also punched in a 2-yard scoring run for Pickford. The teams traded scores in the third quarter, with Boik adding a 4-yard TD run to get the Panthers within 24-20. The Eagles extended their lead when Hayden Niepoth scored on a 26-yard run with 6:02 remaining. Bellaire scored again on defense, as Michael Niepoth picked off a pass and returned it 90 yards for a TD with 4:20 left to make it 37-20. Pickford added a final score as Firack threw a 42-yard TD pass to Derrick Edington. Bellaire outgained Pickford 411 to 282 in total yards. Firack ran for 84 yards on 12 carries, while Boik had 47 yards on 14 tries and Jaycob Soeltner had 37 yards on 12 attempts. Firack was 14-of-24 for 232 passing, with one TD and four interceptions. Edington led the receivers with 10 catches for 155 yards, while Boik added five catches for 87 yards. On defense, Boik and Jack Horton made 12 tackles each and Kurtis Reich had 11 stops. Firack made nine tackles, while Edington had six tackles and two interceptions and Boik also had an interception. Pickford (3-3 overall, 1-3 Bridge Alliance) plays host to Charlton Heston on Friday, Oct. 9. By Staff reports   Staff reports
